translation: Better is one's own duty, though devoid of merit, than the duty of another well discharged. Better is death in one's own duty; the duty of another is fraught with fear.
commentary: 3.35 Better better? Svadharmaḥ ones own duty? Vigunah devoid of merit? paradharmat than the duty of another? self-performed than well discharged? Svadharme in ones own duty? death death? Shreyaḥ better? Paradharma: anothers duty? fearful fraught with fear.Commentary It is indeed better for man to die discharging his own duty though destitute of merit than for him to live doing the duty of another though performed
